reviews.text: Part time ticket office. Car park but can o ly have a parking ticket if you purchase a train ticket. Steep slope up to station so difficult if you have a wheelchair I would think. Departure boards. No toilets. 1 platform. All weather cover. 2 metal poles for bikes.

First time I had been to this station Friendly helpful staff helped me to the car park with my bags and found out if my taxi had arrived .
Very impressed with service provided .
Trains all the way down to Barry island via Cardiff every half hour weekdays

It is what you would expect however,  as is typical with Arriva Trains Wales, the stations are poorly maintained and the trains are ancient. Furthermore, there are no public conveniences at the station, with customer having have to walk to Aberdare bus station.

The station is also beyond dirty and it is not uncommon to see used condoms and syringes there. Arriva need to get their act together. I am giving it two stars only because the trains are on time.
Not very impressive as a train station for a town like Aberdare, deserves a little more.
